workflow.name: Generate Complete Database Schemas with Claude for SQL Databases
workflow.description:
Transform database design from weeks to minutes with this intelligent multi-agent system. Perfect for agencies, consultancies, and SaaS companies offering database architecture as a lead magnet or service.

ü§ñ **4 Specialized AI Agents:**
- **Agent 1 (Architect):** Designs complete schema with tables, relationships, indexes
- **Agent 2 (Reviewer):** Validates design for performance, security, scalability
- **Agent 3 (Optimizer):** Adds advanced features and scores the design (0-100)
- **Agent 4 (SQL Generator):** Creates production-ready migration scripts

üîÑ **Smart Quality Loop:**
Automatically retries up to 3 times if score falls below B grade, feeding previous feedback to improve the design iteratively.

‚ú® **What You Get:**
- Complete database schema (JSON)
- Comprehensive score card with letter grade
- Review feedback with severity levels (Critical/High/Medium/Low)
- Production-ready SQL migration script
- Optional auto-execution in PostgreSQL/MySQL
- Iteration count and optimization recommendations

üíº **Perfect For:**
- Digital agencies offering database design services
- SaaS companies needing rapid prototyping
- Consultancies creating lead magnets
- Developers modernizing legacy systems
- Startups validating data models

üéØ **Use as Lead Magnet:**
Offer free database blueprints to capture leads, then upsell implementation, custom automations, and ongoing optimization services.

‚öôÔ∏è **Technical Highlights:**
- Optimized temperature settings per agent (0.1-0.5)
- Claude Sonnet 4.5 for maximum quality
- Structured JSON output for easy integration
- Error handling and graceful degradation
- Execution time: 60-90 seconds average
- Cost: ~$0.15-0.30 per run

## Use Cases

1. **Agency Lead Magnet**
   Capture leads by offering free database architecture reviews and blueprints

2. **Rapid Prototyping**
   Quickly generate database schemas for MVP development and validation

3. **Legacy System Modernization**
   Help companies redesign outdated database structures with modern best practices

4. **Technical Consulting**
   Provide instant database assessments and recommendations to clients

5. **Educational Tool**
   Teach database design principles through AI-generated examples and feedback

6. **Pre-Sales Tool**
   Demonstrate technical expertise to prospects before engagement

## Key Features

‚úÖ Multi-agent AI collaboration with specialized roles
‚úÖ Automatic quality control and iterative improvement (max 3 retries)
‚úÖ Support for PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, MariaDB
‚úÖ Production-ready SQL script generation
‚úÖ Comprehensive scoring system (Schema/Performance/Scalability/Security)
‚úÖ Optional automatic SQL execution
‚úÖ Detailed feedback with actionable recommendations
‚úÖ Customizable form fields for different industries
‚úÖ Error handling and graceful failures
‚úÖ Complete audit trail of all agent decisions

## Setup Instructions

PREREQUISITES:
- Anthropic API key (Claude Sonnet 4.5 access)
- PostgreSQL/MySQL database (optional, for auto-execution)
- n8n version 1.0+ with LangChain nodes

CONFIGURATION STEPS:

1. Import the workflow JSON into your n8n instance

2. Configure Anthropic API credentials:
   - Add your Anthropic API key in n8n credentials
   - Connect all 4 AI model nodes to your credential

3. (Optional) Configure database connection:
   - In "Execute SQL in PostgreSQL" node, add your database credentials
   - Use a TEST/SANDBOX database, never production
   - Or disable this node if you prefer manual execution

4. Customize the form (optional):
   - Edit form fields in "On form submission" node
   - Add industry-specific questions
   - Adjust required fields based on your needs

5. Test the workflow:
   - Use the form URL to submit a test request
   - Check execution time and quality
   - Verify all agents are responding correctly

6. Customize agent prompts (optional):
   - Adjust system messages for industry-specific requirements
   - Modify scoring criteria in Agent 3
   - Add custom validation rules in Agent 2

7. Deploy:
   - Share the form URL as your lead magnet
   - Embed in website or landing pages
   - Set up email notifications for submissions

COST CONSIDERATIONS:
- Each execution costs ~$0.15-0.30 in API calls
- Failed attempts (retries) increase cost
- Consider rate limiting for public forms

## Requirements

REQUIRED:
- Anthropic API Key (Claude access)
- n8n version 1.0+
- LangChain nodes enabled

OPTIONAL:
- PostgreSQL/MySQL database connection (for auto-execution)
- Email service (for result delivery)
- CRM integration (for lead capture)

## Tags

#ai-agents #database-design #postgresql #mysql #lead-generation #automation #langchain #claude #schema-design #multi-agent #consulting-tool #saas-tool #development #code-generation #sql-generator

üìñ Website: https://evervise.ai/
‚ú® Support: mark.marin@evervise.com

[N8N Link](https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/ds9podzjls6d)

options.systemMessage:
=You are a senior {{ $json.form_data['Database Technology'] }} database architect with 15+ years experience.
You design production-grade schemas that are scalable, normalized, and follow best practices. You consider performance, indexing, and future growth.

Output your design as structured JSON with:
- tables: Array of table objects with:
  - name: string
  - columns: Array of {name, type, constraints, description}
  - primary_key: string or array
  - indexes: Array of {name, columns, type}
  - foreign_keys: Array of {column, references_table, references_column}
- enums: Array of {name, values}
- extensions: Array of extension names needed
- relationships: Description of how tables relate
- reasoning: Explanation for key design decisions

Be thorough and production-ready. Consider the scale and requirements carefully.

You are a {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.form_data['Database Technology'] }} code reviewer and database optimization expert.
Your job is to find issues, enforce best practices, and ensure production-readiness.

Review checklist:
- Normalization (3NF minimum, appropriate denormalization)
- Indexing strategy (missing indexes? over-indexing?)
- Data types (appropriate choices for the database type)
- Constraints (missing NOT NULL? need CHECK constraints?)
- Performance (N+1 query risks? missing composite indexes?)
- Scalability (will this work at 10x, 100x scale?)
- Security (sensitive data? need encryption? row-level security?)
- Missing common fields (created_at, updated_at, soft deletes)
- Relationships properly defined

Output structured feedback in this format:

CRITICAL Issues:
- [Issue 1]
- [Issue 2]

HIGH Priority:
- [Issue 1]

MEDIUM Priority:
- [Issue 1]

LOW Priority / Suggestions:
- [Issue 1]

Positive Aspects:
- [Good thing 1]

Be thorough but fair. If the design is solid, say so.

parameters.text:
=Original Requirements:
{{ JSON.stringify($('Initialize Variables').item.json.form_data, null, 2) }}

Proposed Schema:
{{ $('Agent 1: Database Architect').item.json.output }}

Review Feedback:
{{ $('Agent 2: Schema Reviewer').item.json.output }}

Please:
1. Apply final polish and optimizations to the schema
2. Add advanced features (materialized views, helper functions, useful views)
3. Provide monitoring recommendations
4. Create a comprehensive score card
5. Generate implementation guidance

Score each dimension 0-10 with justification. Be honest but constructive.

options.systemMessage:
You are a {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.form_data['Database Technology'] }} performance optimizer and database strategist.
Apply final polish, add advanced features, and score the design holistically.

Add:
- Performance optimizations (materialized views, covering indexes, partitioning if needed)
- Developer experience improvements (useful views, helper functions)
- Monitoring recommendations (what to track in production)
- Migration strategy (how to deploy safely)
- Backup and disaster recovery considerations

Create a comprehensive score card:

üìä DATABASE ARCHITECTURE SCORE

Overall Grade: [A+, A, A-, B+, B, B-, C+, C, C-, D, F] ([score]/100)

Detailed Scores:
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

Schema Design: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

Performance: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

Scalability: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

Developer Experience: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

Production Readiness: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

Security: [X]/10
[Brief justification]

‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

üí™ Key Strengths:
‚Ä¢ [Strength 1]
‚Ä¢ [Strength 2]
‚Ä¢ [Strength 3]

‚ö†Ô∏è Recommended Improvements:
‚Ä¢ [Improvement 1]
‚Ä¢ [Improvement 2]

üöÄ Next Steps:
1. [Step 1]
2. [Step 2]
3. [Step 3]

Score fairly but be honest. Grade A/B means production-ready, C means needs work, D/F means major issues.

=You are a {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.form_data['Database Technology'] }} SQL script generator.

Take the database schema design and convert it into a complete, production-ready SQL migration script.

Your output must:
- Start with proper transaction handling (BEGIN; ... COMMIT;)
- Include all necessary extensions (for PostgreSQL)
- Create ENUMs before tables that use them
- Create tables in correct dependency order (referenced tables first)
- Add all indexes after table creation
- Add all constraints and triggers
- Include helpful comments explaining complex parts
- Be idempotent where possible (IF NOT EXISTS clauses)
- End with a commented-out rollback script

Format:
-- ============================================
-- Database Migration Script
-- Generated: [timestamp]
-- Database: {{ $('Initialize Variables').item.json.form_data['Database Technology'] }}
-- ============================================

BEGIN;

[Your SQL here]

COMMIT;

-- ============================================
-- ROLLBACK SCRIPT (commented out)
-- ============================================
-- BEGIN;
-- [DROP statements in reverse order]
-- COMMIT;

Output ONLY the SQL script. No markdown code blocks, no explanations.

assignments.name: message
assignments.value: ‚ö†Ô∏è SQL script generated but execution failed. You can still use the script manually.

assignments.name: message
assignments.value: ‚ö†Ô∏è Reached maximum iterations (3). Proceeding with best available design.

parameters.content:
## üìù Form Intake
**User fills database requirements**

‚öôÔ∏è **Customization Options:**
- Add more fields for specific industries
- Add file upload for existing schema
- Add budget field for pricing tiers
- Collect company name for personalization

üí° **Tip:** The more detailed the input, the better the AI agents perform!

## üîß Setup Phase
**Prepares data for agent pipeline**

‚öôÔ∏è **Customization:**
- Store user data in CRM here
- Log to analytics (Mixpanel/Segment)
- Add user identification/tracking

üéØ **Purpose:** Enables retry loop with context

## ü§ñ Agent 1: Architect
**Creates initial schema design**

‚öôÔ∏è **Model Config:**
- Temp: 0.3 (creative but consistent)
- Max tokens: 4000

üé® **Customization:**
- Switch to GPT-4 for cost savings
- Increase temperature for creative solutions
- Add industry-specific templates

üìä **Expected time:** 30-45 seconds

## ü§ñ Agent 2: Reviewer
**Quality control & validation**

‚öôÔ∏è **Model Config:**
- Temp: 0.1 (strict & analytical)
- Max tokens: 3000

üé® **Customization:**
- Add compliance checks (GDPR, HIPAA)
- Add industry-specific validations
- Integrate with linting tools

‚ö° **Expected time:** 20-30 seconds

## ü§ñ Agent 3: Optimizer
**Final polish & scoring**

‚öôÔ∏è **Model Config:**
- Temp: 0.5 (balanced creativity)
- Max tokens: 3500

üé® **Customization:**
- Adjust scoring criteria
- Add performance benchmarking
- Custom grading rubrics per industry

üéØ **Outputs:** Score card + enhancements

## üîÑ Quality Gate
**Ensures high-quality output**

‚öôÔ∏è **Current Logic:**
- A/B grades ‚Üí Proceed ‚úÖ
- C/D/F grades ‚Üí Retry (max 3x)

üé® **Customization:**
- Change threshold (accept C+?)
- Add manual approval step
- Send low scores to human review
- Adjust max retries (1-5)

üí∞ **Trade-off:** More retries = higher cost but better quality

## üîÅ Retry Loop
**Iterative improvement system**

‚öôÔ∏è **Current:** Max 3 attempts

üé® **Customization:**
- Increase max retries for complex projects
- Add different agents for retries
- Implement escalation (retry with Opus)
- Track retry metrics for optimization

üìä **Insight:** Most designs pass in 1-2 iterations

## ü§ñ Agent 4: SQL Generator
**Converts schema to executable SQL**

‚öôÔ∏è **Model Config:**
- Temp: 0.2 (precision critical)
- Max tokens: 4000

üé® **Customization:**
- Add migration versioning (Flyway/Liquibase)
- Generate ORM models (Prisma schema)
- Add seed data generation
- Support multiple SQL dialects

üíæ **Output:** Production-ready SQL script

## ‚úÖ Execution Validation
**Handles success & failures gracefully**

‚öôÔ∏è **Current Behavior:**
- Success ‚Üí Full response
- Failure ‚Üí Script + error details

üé® **Customization:**
- Retry failed SQL automatically
- Send errors to monitoring (Sentry)
- Trigger webhook on success
- Add rollback capability

üéØ **User always gets usable output**

## üöÄ Workflow Overview
**AI Database Architect - Multi-Agent System**

üìä **Performance:**
- Average time: 60-90 seconds
- Success rate: ~85% first attempt
- Cost per run: ~$0.15-0.30

üéØ **Conversion Strategy:**
1. Free: Blueprint + Score
2. Paid: Implementation + 3 automations
3. Enterprise: Full setup + optimization

üìà **Optimization Ideas:**
- A/B test agent prompts
- Cache common patterns
- Pre-built templates for industries
- Parallel agent execution

üí° **Track:** Completion rate, avg score, retry count

## Query Execute

If you are using **PostgreSQL** this will automatically run the script on your database

parameters.content:
## üöÄ Built by Evervise

**Automating the repetitive so you can focus on what matters**

### Need Help?
üìß **Support**: mark.marin@evervise.com
üåê **Website**: [evervise.ai](https://evervise.ai)  
üí¨ **Response Time**: Usually within 24 hours
**License**: Customize freely for your needs

*Questions about customization? We've been there. Reach out.*

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
